Detailed Description

template<class T> template class TypeInfoT

Stores run-time type information (template class).

See the class TypeInfo for a detailed description.

Example Program: See the example of the class TypeInfo

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TypeInfoT ( const char * className,
const char * parentClassName = 0 ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class (use 0 for a base class).

TypeInfoT ( const char * className,
int num,
const char * parentClassName ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object of a class that is template <int num>.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
num   The template parameter.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class.

TypeInfoT ( const char * className,
int num,
const char * parentClassName,
int parentNum ) [inline]
 

Constructs a TypeInfo object of a class that is template <int num> and has a parent that is also template <int num>.

Parameters:
className   The class name.
num   The template parameter.
parentClassName   The name of the parent class.
parentNum   The template parameter of the parent.

Member Function Documentation

void * createObject ( ) const [virtual]
 

Creates a new object of the type, using the default constructor. This is the same as "new Type".

Returns:
A pointer to the new object.

Reimplemented from TypeInfo.

void * createObject ( const char * objectName ) const [virtual]
 

Creates a new object of the type, using the constructor that takes one argument of type objectName. This is the same as "new Type(objectName)".

Parameters:
objectName   Object name, is passed to the constructor.
Returns:
A pointer to the new object.

Reimplemented from TypeInfo.

bool isAbstractClass ( ) const [inline, virtual]
 

Returns false to indicate a non-abstract class.

Returns:
false.

Reimplemented from TypeInfo.
